class_notes: This course offers an introduction to visual anthropology.  It is a field characterized by two distinct constellations of interest.   On the one hand, it encompasses anthropological studies of visual culture ¿ for example painting, photography, architecture, museums, the art market, fashion, media and many other topics.    On the other hand, it includes forms of anthropological inquiry pursued through visual media ¿ for example anthropological photography and ethnographic film.   In this course, we will look at examples from both of the constellations of interest that comprise visual anthropology.
course_description: The course provides an introduction to visual anthropology. It has two foci: the anthropological study of visual practices (painting, art markets, photography, the museum); and anthropological work pursued through film and photography.
